AND The checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked and disabled

title: BOC approving a Bereavement List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps:
When a Major League Bereavement/Family Medical Emergency List transaction is approved 
BUT if it is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List- Reversed" 
AND when it is suppressed,
custom_expected:
THEN it will appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List"
BUt when reversed if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Bereavement List- Reversed" 
AND suppressed then if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.

title: User will receive a notification on the 7th day of a player's Bereavement List placement
custom_preconds: GIVEN  if a player is on or after a player's 7th day of being on the Bereavement List.
custom_steps: WHEN the system runs the nightly check
custom_expected:
THEN a new notification is generated for both the BOC- Major Transactions- Admin and the Club- Major Transactions- Admin users
AND Type will be Inactive List. 
AND The notification description should be Please Reinstate from Major League Bereavement / Family Medical Emergency List. 
AND Both the player name and the notification description should link to the Player's Player History.

title: BOC- Admin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC admin
AND is in the tx
custom_expected:
THEN Can view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Major league transactions for Major League players. 
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Major League transactions and see associated Flags.

title: BOC- Basic
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is logged in as BOC basic
AND is viewing the tx
custom_expected:
THEN Can view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Club- Admin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user is logged in as a club admin
AND is viewing the tx
custom_expected:
THEN can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 
      However, there are exceptions:
      1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
      2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field

AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
      1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
      2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
      3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
 
AND Can NOT create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any BOC only Major League transactions for Major League players.

title: Club- Basic
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as basic club
AND is viewing the tx
custom_expected:
THEN can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.

          However, there are exceptions:
                  1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
                  2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
                  3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
 
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
 
    1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
    2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
    3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

custom_expected: THEN the button should be greyed out

custom_steps: WHEN clicking Delete
custom_expected:
THEN the form should be closed and no record should be kept. 
AND User should be returned to entry point of the transaction 
AND a blue notification should be thrown

title: Club user will receive a notification when my Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx is approved, rejected, or reversed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club user is on the notification widget
custom_steps:
WHEN the Initiating Club (or the Club that the player belongs to) is updated to Approved, Rejected, or Reversed
BUT not Suppressed
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a notification
AND the "Description" will be a hyperlink.

title: User can edit an existing Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx for a player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has edit permissions
AND has a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking Edit
custom_expected:
THEN In Preliminary or Rejected state, Club users will be able to edit all portions displayed on the form. 
AND BOC is able to edit all fields in all states except for Approved and Reversed transactions.
BUT In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives Clubs access to attach new files,
AND the Club cannot edit any other part of transaction
AND In Approved and Reversed transactions, edit only gives BOC access to attach new files or edit existing attachments. 
AND BOC can also update "Comments" and "BOC Notes" fields, 
BUT BOC cannot edit any other part of transaction

title: User can add a new Authorized Signatory from a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has edit permissions
AND the Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx is in Edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "New" it will launch a modal that allows the user to enter a new Authorized Signatory for the player's Org.
custom_expected:
THEN The checkbox associated with the form the user is adding a new signatory from will be auto checked and disabled.
AND The Save button will be disabled until all required fields have been populated.
AND Clicking "Save" will add the authorized signatory to the system and close the modal, with the "Authorized Signatory" field pre-populated with the newly added Authorized Signatory. 
AND The Authorized SIgnatory will be added to the authorized signatory widget and will appear for the Org for all users that have permission to view that Org's Authorized Signatories.
AND Clicking Cancel will cancel the addition of the authorized signatory, and return the user to the form.

title: Club user can be prevented from initiating a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx for a player that does not belong to my Club
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Org of the initiating user is not BOC or the Current Org of the player
custom_steps: WHEN Selecting "Place on Voluntarily Retired List" on the MN Create New menu for a player from their Player History
custom_expected:
THEN then the blocker will display:"You do not have permission to create a transaction for a player that belongs to another Organization."
**Hint Text:**"If you believe you have received this message in error, please contact the BOC."  
BUT If the Org of the initiating user is BOC, then they will be allowed to create the transaction.

title: User will receive an error when stats are found for a player on or after the entered tx date
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
AND the player has any stats on or after the entered transaction date
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN the error will display "Statistics have been found for the player on or after the entered placement date. "
AND Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: BOC Approver will receive an error when attempting to approve a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx for a player that has a prior pending tx
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a  Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx 
AND the player has another pending transaction with a transaction date prior to the current transaction.
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the blocker will display "This transaction cannot be approved while a previously submitted transaction is pending."

title: Recalculate player's CBT impact on approval of Place on Voluntarily Retired List
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Approve"
custom_expected: THEN the system should recalculate the CBT impact of the player.

title: BOC user approving a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx to create an entry in the daily tx bulletin
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user has a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List tx
custom_steps: WHEN the tx is approved, reversed or suppressed
custom_expected:
THEN when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is approved it should appear on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Placed on Voluntarily Retired List"
AND when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed. If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Place on Voluntarily Retired List - Reversed" 
AND when a MJ Place on Voluntarily Retired List transaction is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.

title: A BOC user will see a blue notification when I place a player on the Restricted List from a Submitted Voluntarily Retired List transaction
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has clicked on the "Place on Restricted List" button on a Voluntarily Retired transaction
AND the following have all occurred successfully:  
     - Reject the Place on Voluntarily Retired transaction. 
     - Create and approve a Place on Restricted List transaction for the player with a placement date = the placement date from the Place on Voluntarily Retired transaction and a "Reason for Placement" of "Failure to submit Voluntarily Retired Letter"
     - Add the comment "Player originally placed on VR list by club." to the Restricted List transaction. 
     - Load the Place on Restricted List transaction for the player in view mode.
custom_expected:
THEN the system will display a blue notification stating that the Voluntarily Retired transaction was rejected 
AND the Restricted List transaction was approved.

title: BOC user approving a MJ Reinstate from Inactive List tx will create an entry in the daily transaction bulletin
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a MJ Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is approved, reversed, or supprssed
AND a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN on the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin
custom_expected:
THEN approved will appear as "Reinstated from [Insert Transaction Short Name]" (Ex: Reinstated from Paternity List). If the transaction has Appoint as 26th Man checked, then append "as 26th Man"
AND reversed, if the "approved" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed
BUT  If it was on a previous Bulletin, then a new entry should be added to the current Pending Daily Transaction Bulletin as "Reinstated from [Insert Transaction Short Name] - Reversed". 
AND if the transaction had Appoint as 26th Man checked, then append "as 26th Man" prior to - Reversed. 
AND when a MJ Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is suppressed, if the "reversed" bulletin entry is still on the Pending Bulletin, it should be removed.

title: Receive error Reinstating MN player from Restricted list between 8/1 and end of MN league season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a player playing in the minor leagues
AND if yes they system will check that the reinstatement date does not fall on or between August 1st and the end of season (including playoffs) of the Club's season dates.
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" 
AND the date is on or between those dates, and the player is not on the Restricted List for a drug violation,
custom_expected:
THEN the error will display "This player cannot be reinstated between 8/1 and the conclusion of the Minor League championship season ([insert end of season date for player's Minor League club])."
AND Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: Receive error Reinstating MN player from certain statuses between 8/1 and end of MN league season
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a player playing in the minor leagues. 
AND if yes , the system will check that the reinstatement date does not fall on or between August 1st and the end of season (including playoffs) of the Club's season dates
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
AND if the date is on or between those dates, and the player is not on the Restricted List for a drug violation
custom_expected:
THEN display the error, "This player cannot be reinstated between 8/1 and the conclusion of the Minor League championship season ([insert end of season date for player's Minor League club])."
AND  Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: Receive error if the active or under control limit will be exceeded
custom_preconds: GIVEN the reinstate from Inactive List transaction, will put the relevant Major League Org or Minor League Club over their under control or active roster limits.
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN the error will display, The club [Club name] will exceed the Active List or Under Control limit.
Active Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#]
Under Control Limit: [Limit #] Actual: [Actual#]"
AND Clicking Ignore and Continue will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: Receive error Reinstating a MJ player from the Paternity list before 1 day or after 3 days
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a MJ League player currently on the Paternity List.
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" 
AND the system will check that there are not fewer than one day or more than three days between the Reinstatement date and the Placement date from the Paternity List transaction
custom_expected: THEN the error will display  "Players cannot be on the Paternity List for less than one day or more than three days."

title: Receive error Reinstating MN player from Temp Inactive list before 3 days
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a MN League player currently on the Temporarily Inactive List.
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve" 
AND the system will check that there are not fewer than three days between the Reinstatement date and the Placement date from the Temporarily Inactive List transaction
AND the current date does not fall outside of the Org's season
custom_expected: THEN display the error "This player cannot be reinstated from the Temporarily Inactive List until [insert date 3 days from the Temporarily Inactive List placement date]."

title: Receive error Reinstating player from Vol Retired list prior to 60 in season days
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a player currently on the Voluntarily Retired List.
custom_steps:
WHEN  Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
AND the system will check that there are not fewer than 60 in-season days (using Club's season dates including playoffs) between the Reinstatement date and the Placement date from the Voluntarily Retired List transaction.
custom_expected: THEN display the error "This player cannot be reinstated from the Voluntarily Retired List until [insert date 60 days from the Voluntarily Retired List placement date]."

title: Error when attempting to Reinstate a MJ player from the Restricted list between 8/1 and 10/31
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a MJ League player.
AND If yes , and the player is being Reinstated from the Ineligible List, Disqualified List, Voluntarily Retired List or the Restricted List, the system will check that the reinstatement date does not fall on or between August 1st and October 31st.
custom_steps:
WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
AND If the date is on or between those dates
custom_expected:
THEN the error will display "This player cannot be reinstated between 8/1 and 10/31."
BUT If the player is being Reinstated from the Restricted List and the player is on the Restricted List immediately following a Bereavement List placement, or for a drug violation, then this rule does not apply.

title: Error when attempting to Reinstate a MJ player from the Bereavement list before three days or after seven days
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List transaction is for a MJ League player currently on the Bereavement List.
AND If yes, the system will check that there are not fewer than three days or more than seven days between the Reinstatement date and the Placement date from the Bereavement List transaction.
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking "Submit" or "Approve"
custom_expected:
THEN the error will display "Players cannot be on the Bereavement list for fewer than three days or more than seven days."
AND Clicking Ignore and Continue (only available for the BOC) will ignore the error and continue with the transaction.

title: Being Reinstated from IL will reinstate a player from all Inactive Lists
custom_preconds: GIVEN a player has one or more inactive list status'
custom_steps: WHEN  a player is reinstated from the Inactive List
custom_expected:
THEN they will be reinstated from ALL inactive lists
AND moved back to the roster status that they had prior to being placed on an Inactive List

title: Use Playoff dates when calculating reinstatement period
Recalculate player's CBT impact on approval of Reinstate from Inactive List
custom_preconds: GIVEN the Reinstate from Inactive List
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Approve
custom_expected: THEN the system will recalculate the CBT impact of the player.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Minor)
custom_expected:
THEN ADMINS can view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Minor league transactions for Minor League players
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Minor League transactions and see associated Flags
BUT BASIC Can only view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - Club - Minor Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Minor)
custom_expected:
THEN as a BASIC Club users can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction
BUT as an ADMIN Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions
AND Can create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any non-BOC Only Minor League transactions for Minor League players (ADMIN)
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions
AND cannot see suppressed tx
AND cannot see BOC Notes field
AND  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org (ADMIN)

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - BOC - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Major)
custom_expected:
THEN ADMINS can view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states
AND Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Minor league transactions for Minor League players
AND Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Minor League transactions and see associated Flags
BUT BASIC Can only view and Print all minor league transactions in all states for Minor League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
AND Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Reinstate from Inactive List Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a Club user
custom_steps: WHEN on a Reinstate from Inactive List tx (Major)
custom_expected:
THEN as a BASIC Club users can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction
BUT as an ADMIN Club users with this role can view and print all minor league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions
AND Can create, delete, submit, edit, or attach files to any non-BOC Only Minor League transactions for Minor League players (ADMIN)
AND Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) minor league transactions including other club's Minor League transactions or BOC only transactions
AND cannot see suppressed tx
AND cannot see BOC Notes field
AND  Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
AND Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org (ADMIN)

title: BOC user can edit an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a new manual entry that has been saved to the player history
AND a pencil icon appears in view mode for ONLY the rows that have been manually added
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the pencil icon places the entire row in edit mode, and enables a save button.
custom_expected:
THEN user has the ability to edit all values of the manual entry
AND Save must be clicked to maintain any changes to the row

title: BOC user can cancel all changes to edits in a player's history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user
AND one or more row is in edit mode
AND Cancel All Changes button appears to the right of the Save button
custom_steps: WHEN the cancel button is clicked
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive a blocking message asking them to confirm the cancellation.
AND If they confirm, the widget is refreshed into view mode and none of the edits are reflected.
BUT If they do not confirm, the message closes and they are returned to the widget in edit mode.

title: BOC user can delete an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is a BOC user 
AND there is an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
AND a trash can icon appears on any row that has been manually added to the Player History.
AND the icon appears for both entries that have been previously saved and newly added entries that have not yet been saved.
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking the trash can on entries that were previously saved will prompt the user to confirm the deletion of the row.
custom_expected:
THEN If they confirm, the row is permanently deleted 
AND a blue notification is thrown confirming the deletion
BUT If they do not confirm then the row is maintained. 
AND Clicking the trash can on entries that have not been previously saved will just remove the row.
AND If the row that is being removed was the only row in edit mode, then the entire widget is returned to view mode.

title: User can filter the Player History
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user in on a Player's Player History
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking the filter icon
custom_expected:
THEN filter pop-out will be displayed
AND the available filters will be:
- Contracts
     - Major Transactions
     - Minor Transactions
     - Misc
     - Employees (to be added later)
AND Contracts filter will have "All" selected by default. 
BUT Deselecting All will enable the multi-select dropdown with the options Major, Minor and Employee. 
AND Selecting "Minor" will include all Minor Contract associated items (including all addenda)
AND Major and Minor Transactions filters will have "All" selected by default.
BUT  Deselecting All will enable the multi-select dropdown with a list of the Major or Minor Transactions in the system available as options. 
AND The two exceptions are that all Disabled List and Rehab transactions should be lumped under the option "All D/L"
AND any inactive list transaction should be lumped under "Inactive Lists" as an option. 
AND Applying the filters will filter the player history to the user's selections.

BASIC:

title: A Club user can load an existing Passed Over player profile to sign him

AND If the viewing Club does not have a profile for the player, load the BOC profile. 
AND If the viewing Club does not have a profile for the player and there is no BOC Copy, load the first entry for the player from the most recent draft (that the Club has permission to view).

title: Updates to Domestic Amateur Quick Search

custom_steps: WHEN in the Quick Search
custom_expected:
THEN Clubs should start to see Passed Over players, even from other Clubs in the Quick Search population
AND the population of players should go back 5 draft years
AND  include all future draft years as well. 
AND each player should only appear in quick search once. 
BUT Club users do not see "Multiple" or other Club origins
AND if they entered the player and he was not also entered by the MLSB or was a Re-Draft, he will show their Org's abbreviation. 
AND if he was entered by more than one other club and not the viewing Club, then his origin will read "Club"
AND Clubs should continue to NOT see other Clubs' current year players in quick search.

title: A user can view the player's Drafted record up until the Signing Deadline, unless the player is marked as Not Subject to Deadline
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a player is not marked Not Subject to Deadline
AND the current date is past the Signing Deadline date
custom_steps: WHEN there is any Drafted player profile in the system.
custom_expected:
THEN user will be able to open and view it
AND when the profile loads, if the player was drafted in the most recent draft
AND the current date is before the Signing Deadline
THEN always load the previous year's draft record
AND NOT the current year's pending eligible record. 
BUT if the player was drafted in the most recent draft and the current date is after the Signing Deadline
AND if the record is marked Not Subject to Deadline
THEN continue to load the previous year's draft record.

title: A Club user can edit an existing Passed Over player profile so club can sign him
custom_preconds:

title: Required fields check on int't amateur reg. profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN user is editing an international amateur player profile
custom_steps:
WHEN required fields are missing
AND user clicks Save
custom_expected:
THEN user receives an error

**Required fields are as followed and should contain a red asterisk:
Bio Information 
- Users must enter a  Middle Name and Extended Last Name or check the associated checkboxes. 
- When the user checks one of the checkboxes, the associated entry field will hide. 
- If users have entered text in the entry field and then checked the associated check box, the text will also hide 
- Roster First Name is required
- Twin Count is required. Possible values for Twin Count are 0-8. 
- Birth Country, Birth State, Birth City are required
(Note: Clubs are not able to edit Bio information)

Scouting Information
- Position(s) is required 
- Language is required  

Contact Information
- Phone number(s) fields are required 
- Email Address(es) fields are NOT required 
- Address(s) fields are required 
     - Zip Code is only displayed for the United States, Canada and US territories (Puerto Rico, Guam, US Virgin Islands)
     - Formatting checks will only be done if the country selected is the United States. In that case, the system will need to verify that 5 numbers have been entered for the Zip Code field.

AND header should include Scouting Information section

title: BOC permissions
custom_expected:
The transaction has a view permission set that can be added to an existing user if needed. Users without the permission cannot view the form anywhere in the system.

ADMINS:
Can view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players.
Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.
Can create, delete, edit, e-sign and submit all Major league transactions for Major League players. 
Can Approve, Reject, Reverse and Suppress all Major League transactions and see associated Flags.

BASIC:
Can view and Print all major league transactions [Club and BOC] in all states for Major League Players but cannot make any changes or e-sign.
Can view all flags for all transactions and transaction attachments in all states.

title: Rule 6 Return Process Permissions - Club - Major Transactions
custom_expected:
BASIC:
Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transaction. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
Exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot edit or change these transactions (Basic only)
3. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org

ADMIN:
Club users with this role can view and print all major league transactions in all states when the logged in Org matches the "From Org" for that transactions. It does not matter if the BOC or the club initiated the transaction. It also does not matter which Org the involved player currently belongs too.
 Exceptions:
1. No Transactions that are in Suppressed state
2. They cannot see "BOC Notes" field
Club users with this role Can view all APPROVED (no other states) major league transactions including other club's Major League transactions or BOC only transactions with the following exceptions:
1.  Cannot see BOC Notes field for any transaction
2. Cannot see the Comments field for any transaction unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org. Note that even if the player involved is currently part of their Org, they still cannot see the comments field unless they are the From Org or To Org
3. Attached Files section in the transaction form unless the logged in Org is the From Org or To Org
Can create, delete, submit, edit, attach files, and e-sign all Majnor League transactions for Major League players on their Org's roster or if they are the"From Org" or "To Org".
